translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the One who Gave a Leaf
The Story of the Elder Upaṭṭhākadāyaka
“As he was going along the road,🔽the receiver of offerings,
the great nāga, the leader of the two-footed beings,
the best in the world, the bull of a man.
I invited him,
the one who is for the welfare of the whole world,
and I gave him a personal attendant,
to the great seer Siddhattha.
The Buddha, the one with supernormal power,
the great sage, accepted him,
and after rising from his seat,
he went off to the east.
For ninety-four eons,
because of that gift of a personal attendant,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a personal attendant.
For fifty-seven eons,
I was the one named Balasena,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Upaṭṭhākadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā upaṭṭhākadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Upaṭṭhākadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai upaṭṭhāka dāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽upaṭṭhāka dāyaka therassa apadānam chaṭṭha
translated: The Story of the Elder Upaṭṭhākadāyaka is the sixth.
